my review of this game
War Selection is basically “Age of Empire-like chaos but 40x more stuff and way more people”.
Everyone starts in stone age and then splits into different cultures → which leads into different countries → which leads into giant tech divergence. You can end in WW1-ish airships. You can also die in bronze age to 30 dudes with sticks. That’s the type of game it is.
what’s fun
massive matches with dozens of players → the map becomes pure insanity
tech progression feels satisfying (stone → bronze → iron → tanks)
huge amount of units + buildings, so you can find your favorite playstyle
sandbox mode lets you chill and build a “museum city” if you want
what’s not fun
– match pacing is long and sometimes exhausting
– balance is… let’s just say “experimental”
– UI and onboarding do not hold your hand at all
– if someone knows a broken opener and you don’t → have fun being deleted

Graphics are simple but good enough for big battles, and the game is surprisingly optimized. It can feel grindy sometimes, and new players may get overwhelmed, but overall it’s one of the most fun free-to-play RTS games with huge replay value.

Игра War Selection - это отличная RTS, предлагающая уникальное сочетание исторической прогрессии и стратегической глубины. Начиная с каменного века, вы проводите свою цивилизацию через различные эпохи, выбирая направление развития, от которого радикально зависит ваша тактика и юниты. Решения, какой путь технологий выбрать, играют решающую роль в победе.

Мне понравилось разнообразие фракций, каждая со своими сильными и слабыми сторонами, что добавляет реиграбельности. Ресурсменеджмент не перегруженный, но требует внимания, особенно при переходе в более поздние эпохи. Графика не самая современная, но она вполне функциональна и позволяет легко различать юниты на поле боя.

Несмотря на некоторую кривую обучения для новичков, War Selection вознаграждает тех, кто готов потратить время на изучение механик. Масштабные сражения действительно впечатляют, а возможность наблюдать, как лучники каменного века сражаются против танков времен Второй мировой войны, просто захватывает дух. Рекомендую эту игру всем любителям стратегий, ищущим что-то новое и интересное.

A game that doesn't respect your time. Illusion of choice, "Strategy" is thrown out the window because at a certain point in the game, it just becomes a glorified Wonder Rush. Linear, slow, and repetitive.

Now tell me, is that really strategy.

If you respect yourself, stray away from this heaping pile of garbage. It's a waste of your time.

It's a RTS game with potential, where each nation is somehow different and their soundtrack is good, a game where you start in stone age and go up to industrial age, but at the moment I can't recommend it, mostly because the community is small and still there are many weak players in TDM game mode, destroying the whole experience and leaving other players frustrated. One player decides to quit or die and suddenly half of team leave the game, so very often it's pointless to play further as you will often lose by playing current match. Unfortunately recently it's often like that. Other problems are below.

1. Workers going too far from workplace of blocking each other path.
2. Not balanced nations with OP Italy or USSR.
3. Slow game development. The game still does not include North American nations, even though plans to add them to the game were made long ago. If you're new player, you won't get bored with unlocking new nations and having fun testing them, because, as I wrote above, each one is quite unique, but old players sometimes could get bored with all or most nations unlocked.
4. Lack of map variety. I would like to see map types from Age of Empires. But it's a good thing that maps are not manually made and each time they look different, as game include random map generator.
5. Sometimes it gets laggy, with units teleporting on map (I have very good and stable Internet connection).
6. Walls building is broken. Often workers leave a gap and you must always watch them.
7. This is a minor problem, but they should also add better anti-aliasing option, as game probably use blurry FXAA or TAA. I'm not sure if it's safe to use ReShade with SMAA, to not get banned.

Hope that this game will get better in coming years, but right now, sometimes I seriously think about quitting, mostly because of weak players.

Great idea for a game but would stay away for now.

Fist you have the multiple bugs like building not letting you upgrade even if you have everything needed.

Then there is ui issues were the friends panel cannot be closed and gets in the way if you scale your screen which i had to do so i could play from further away the text is also badly done with the population count being green, yellow or red or white and non of them being easy to see even at a scaled resolution.

On top of that it would be nice to have small things like hovering over the population count should show the number of workers you have vs others as some unlocks require a worker amount but you have no clue how to see how many you have already.

Items like meat which is vital for food in the beginning need a highlight or something as they are hard to see on the ground especially when you have grass turned on which makes it impossible to play properly as you cannot see or click on anything on any meat on the ground.

Also ran into an issue with the function hotkeys not always working when pressed though this happened on one computer but wasn't an issue on another.

Overall this game is a great idea but needs a lot of fixes and improvements and since it is in beta i will keep an eye on it and will not judge it too much until the full release.

-------Extras-------

Things i think would help the game:

1. Give new players a token to unlock one country so they can at least see what the game plays like with a country (I understand this is a free game and needs to make money but if people play a match and make all that progress with fun weapon and army types and then have only the option to go abstract basically snatching away all that progress and giving them generic shit then they are more likely to stop playing right then and there.)

2. Add enemy A.I to the private match so you can play with one other person in a team against A.I and work together

3. Change the key rebind UI as it will be too confusing for older players and those who don't play much

4. if there are any differences between countries then hovering over the country in the private match part in the main menu should tell you them.

If you're new player, you won't get bored with unlocking new nations and having fun testing them, because, as I wrote above, each one is quite unique, but old players sometimes could get bored with all or most nations unlocked.
4. Lack of map variety. I would like to see map types from Age of Empires. But it's a good thing that maps are not manually made and each time they look different, as game include random map generator.
5. Sometimes it gets laggy, with units teleporting on map (I have very good and stable Internet connection).
6. Walls building is broken. Often workers leave a gap and you must always watch them.
7. This is a minor problem, but they should also add better anti-aliasing option, as game probably use blurry FXAA or TAA. I'm not sure if it's safe to use ReShade with SMAA, to not get banned.

Hope that this game will get better in coming years, but right now, sometimes I seriously think about quitting, mostly because of weak players.
